sense.name: care about, be bothered by, be concerned by
sense.commentary: NOTE: Be careful about non-verbal uses of NEVERMIND (can be 1 word or 2) as in "Nevermind the pizza, I'll have doughnuts." or "The executives got massive bonuses, nevermind that 10k employees had been fired." In these sentences, NEVERMIND is being used as a conjunction. Syntax Includes: NP1[agent[animate]] MIND NP2[patient[abstract]] NP1[agent[animate]] MIND ADVP NP1[agent[animate]] MIND COMP
sense.examples: Do you mind if I smoke? He never minded when she came home late from the office. She doesn't mind that I'm a vegetarian. Never mind. I never mind the long lines at the market.

sense.name: take care of; tend
sense.examples: Will you mind the store while I run out for a minute? She agreed to mind the children if we pay her in pies.

sense.name: pay attention to; heed, give consideration to, make a note
sense.examples: Mind that first step; it's loose. You should mind your mother. I never wanted a big house, mind you, but my husband insisted.
